sen.j: 大覚寺（だいかくじ）
sen.e: Daikaku-ji Temple
Daikaku-ji Temple
Daikaku-ji Temple

sen.j: 京都市右京区にある真言宗大覚寺派大本山の寺院。
sen.e: The head temple of the Shingon sect Daikaku-ji School of Zen Buddhism located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The head temple of the Shingon sect Daikaku-ji School located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The head temple of the Shingon sect Daikaku-ji School located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 本項にて記述。
sen.e: It is described within the main article.
It is described within the main article.
It is described within the main article.

sen.j: 兵庫県姫路市にある浄土宗の寺院。
sen.e: A Pure Land sect temple located in Himeji City, Hyogo Prefecture.
A Pure Land sect temple located in Himeji City, Hyogo Prefecture.
A Pure Land sect temple located in Himeji City, Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: 別項「大覚寺 (姫路市)」を参照。
sen.e: Refer to the article 'Daikaku-ji Temple (Himeji City).
Refer to the article 'Daikaku-ji Temple (Himeji City).'
Refer to the article 'Daikaku-ji Temple (Himeji City).'

sen.j: 滋賀県愛知郡 (滋賀県)愛東町大覚寺にある天台宗の寺院。
sen.e: A Tendai sect temple located in Daikakuji, Aito-cho, Echi-gun, Shiga Prefecture.
A Tendai sect temple located in Daikakuji, Aito-cho, Echi-gun, Shiga Prefecture.
A Tendai sect temple located in Daikakuji, Aito-cho, Echi-gun, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 茨城県石岡市大増にある浄土真宗本願寺派の寺院。
sen.e: A True Pure Land sect Hongan-ji School temple located in Omasu, Ishioka City, Ibaraki Prefecture.
A True Pure Land sect Hongan-ji School temple located in Omasu, Ishioka City, Ibaraki Prefecture.
A True Pure Land sect Hongan-ji School temple located in Omasu, Ishioka City, Ibaraki Prefecture.

sen.j: 大覚寺（だいかくじ）は、京都市右京区嵯峨野にある、真言宗大覚寺派大本山の寺院。
sen.e: Daikaku-ji Temple, situated in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is the head temple of the Shingon sect Daikaku-ji School of Zen Buddhism.
Daikaku-ji Temple, situated in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is the head temple of the Shingon sect Daikaku-ji School.
Daikaku-ji Temple, situated in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is the head temple of the Shingon sect Daikaku-ji School.

sen.j: 山号を嵯峨山と称する。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Sagasan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Sagasan.'
Its honorific mountain prefix is Sagasan.

sen.j: 本尊は不動明王を中心とする五大明王、開基は嵯峨天皇である。
sen.e: Emperor Saga was the temple's kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) and the principal objects of veneration are the Five Wisdom Kings centered around Fudo Myoo.
sen.cmt: ・Emperor Saga: 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)・Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding）: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm・Fudo Myoo: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: Emperor Saga was the temple's kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding and the principal objects of veneration are the Five Great Wisdom Kings centered around Fudo Myoo.
sen.cmt: andの前のスペースを調整。Greatを補足。
sen.e: Emperor Saga was the temple's kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) and the principal objects of veneration are the Five Great Wisdom Kings centered around Fudo Myoo.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇の離宮を寺に改めた皇室ゆかりの寺院である。
sen.e: The temple has a close connection to the emperor, having been converted from Emperor Saga's villa.
sen.cmt: ・Emperor Saga: 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)
sen.e: The temple has a close connection to the imperial household, having been converted from Emperor Saga's villa.
The temple has a close connection to the imperial household, having been converted from Emperor Saga's villa.

sen.j: また、後宇多天皇がここで院政を行うなど、日本の政治史に深い関わりをもつ寺院である。
sen.e: It is also deeply related to the political history of Japan, with Emperor Go-Uda governing from within.
It is also deeply related to the political history of Japan, with Emperor Go-Uda governing from within.
It is also deeply related to the political history of Japan, with Emperor Go-Uda governing from within.

sen.j: また、嵯峨天皇に始まるという華道嵯峨御流を今に伝える寺でもある。
sen.e: It is the home of the Saga Goryu school of ikebana that originated with Emperor Saga and continues to flourish today.
It is the home of the Saga Goryu school of ikebana that originated with Emperor Saga and continues to flourish today.
It is the home of the Saga Goryu school of ikebana that originated with Emperor Saga and continues to flourish today.

sen.j: 寺の境内（大沢池など）では映画やテレビ（特に時代劇）などの撮影がよく行われている。
sen.e: The temple precinct (Osawa-no-ike Pond etc.) is often used as a location for shooting films and television programs (especially period dramas).
The temple precinct (Osawa-no-ike Pond etc.) is often used as a location for shooting films and television programs (especially period dramas).
The temple precinct (Osawa-no-ike Pond etc.) is often used as a location for shooting films and television programs (especially period dramas).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 嵯峨野の北東に位置するこの地には、平安時代初期に在位した嵯峨天皇が離宮を営んでいた。
sen.e: In the Heian period, Emperor Saga's villa stood on this site in the northeast of Sagano.
sen.cmt: ・Emperor Saga: 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)
sen.e: In the Heian period, Emperor Saga's villa stood on this site in the northeast of Sagano.
At the beginning of Heian period, Emperor Saga's villa stood on this site in the northeast of Sagano.
sen.cmt: In the Heian period→At the beginning of Heian period

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇の信任を得ていた空海が、離宮内に五大明王を安置する堂を建て、修法を行ったのが起源とされる。
sen.e: Kukai, who had the confidence of Emperor Saga, constructed a hall housing the Five Wisdom Kings within the emperor's villa.
Kukai, who had the confidence of Emperor Saga, constructed a hall housing the Five Great Wisdom Kings within the emperor's villa.
Kukai, who had the confidence of Emperor Saga, constructed a hall housing the Five Great Wisdom Kings within the emperor's villa.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇が死去してから30数年後の貞観 (日本)18年（876年）、皇女の正子内親王（淳和天皇皇后）が離宮を寺に改めたのが大覚寺である。
sen.e: In the year 876, over 30 years after Emperor Saga's death, Imperial princess Masako (empress to Emperor Junna) converted the villa into Daikaku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ・Imperial princess Masako: 英辞郎 on the WEB （-内親王)
sen.e: In the year 876, over 30 years after Emperor Saga's death, Imperial princess Masako (empress to Emperor Junna) converted the villa into Daikaku-ji Temple.
In the year 876, over 30 years after Emperor Saga's death, Imperial princess Masako (empress to Emperor Junna) converted the villa into Daikaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 淳和天皇の皇子（嵯峨天皇には孫にあたる）恒貞親王（恒寂（こうじゃく）法親王、仁明天皇の廃太子）を開山（初代住職）とした。
sen.e: Emperor Junna's son (grandson of Emperor Saga) Imperial Prince Tsunesada (Kojaku-Hosshinno, disinherited heir of Emperor Nimmyo) served as kaizan (first chief priest).
Emperor Junna's son (grandson of Emperor Saga) Imperial Prince Tsunesada (Kojaku-Hosshinno, disinherited heir of Emperor Nimmyo) served as kaisan (first chief priest).
sen.cmt: kaizan→kaisan 別ファイルでも訂正しましたが、kaisanが主流の読み方です。
sen.e: Emperor Junna's son (grandson of Emperor Saga) Imperial Prince Tsunesada (Kojaku-Hosshinno, disinherited heir of Emperor Nimmyo) served as kaisan (first chief priest).

sen.j: 鎌倉時代になると、亀山天皇や後宇多法皇が入寺し、ここで院政を行ったため「嵯峨御所」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, Emperor Kameyama and the abdicated monk-emperor Go-Uda entered the temple and governed from within, which led to it being called 'Saga Palace'.
In the Kamakura period, Emperor Kameyama and the abdicated monk-emperor Go-Uda entered the temple and governed from within, which led to it being called 'Saga Palace.'
In the Kamakura period, Emperor Kameyama and the Cloistered Emperor Go-Uda entered the temple and governed from within, which led to it being called 'Saga Palace.'

sen.j: なかでも、後宇多法皇は伽藍の整備に力を尽くしたため、「中興の祖」と称されている。
sen.e: The abdicated monk-emperor Go-Uda became known as the "the father of restoration" due to the great effort that he put into maintaining and repairing the monastery.
The abdicated monk-emperor Go-Uda became known as the 'the father of restoration' due to the great effort that he put into maintaining and repairing the monastery.
The Cloistered Emperor Go-Uda became known as the 'the father of restoration' due to the great effort that he put into maintaining and repairing the monastery.

sen.j: 亀山法皇・後宇多法皇の系統は当寺にちなんで「大覚寺統」と呼ばれ、後深草天皇の系統の「持明院統」と交代で帝位についた。
sen.e: The temple was named after the ancestries of abdicated emperor monks Kameyama and Go-Uda to become 'Daikakuji-to' before changing 'Jimyoin-to' after the ancestry of Emperor Go-Fukakusa.
The temple was named after the ancestries of abdicated emperor monks Kameyama and Go-Uda to become 'Daikakuji-to' before changing 'Jimyoin-to' after the ancestry of Emperor Go-Fukakusa.
The temple was named after the ancestries of Cloistered Emperor Kameyama and Go-Uda to become 'Daikakuji-to' before changing 'Jimyoin-to' after the ancestry of Emperor Go-Fukakusa.
sen.cmt: ”abdicated emperor monks”→”Cloistered Emperor”に変更しました。

sen.j: この両系統が対立したことが、後の南北朝時代 (日本)分裂につながったことはよく知られる。
sen.e: The connection between the opposition of these two imperial lines and the later split into the Northern and Southern Courts period is well known.
The connection between the opposition of these two imperial lines and the later split into the Northern and Southern Courts period is well known.
The connection between the opposition of these two imperial lines and the later split into the Northern and Southern Court period is well known.

sen.j: 元中9年（1392年）、南北朝の和解が成立し、南朝 (日本)最後の天皇である後亀山天皇から北朝 (日本)の後小松天皇に「三種の神器」が引き継がれたのも、ここ大覚寺においてであった。
sen.e: The Northern and Southern Courts period was reconciled in 1392 and the handing over of the Three Sacred Treasures of Japan from final emperor of the Southern Court, Emperor Go-Kameyama, to the final emperor of the northern court, Emperor Go-Komatsu, took place at Daikaku-ji Temple.

The Northern and Southern Courts period was reconciled in 1392 and the handing over of the Three Sacred Treasures of Japan from final emperor of the Southern Court, Emperor Go-Kameyama, to the final emperor of the northern court, Emperor Go-Komatsu, took place at Daikaku-ji Temple.

The Northern and Southern Courts period was reconciled in 1392 and the handing over of the Three Sacred Treasures of Japan from final emperor of the Southern Court, Emperor Go-Kameyama, to the final emperor of the northern court, Emperor Go-Komatsu, took place at Daikaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: このように、皇室ゆかりの寺院であり、代々法親王が住職となった門跡寺院であるため、現在でも御所風の雰囲気がただよっている。
sen.e: The temple holds a deep connection to the imperial household with successive imperial princes serving as chief priest so that, even today, it maintains the feel of an imperial palace.
The temple holds a deep connection to the imperial household with successive imperial princes serving as chief priest so that, even today, it maintains the feel of an imperial palace.
The temple holds a deep connection to the imperial household with successive imperial princes serving as chief priest so that, even today, it maintains the feel of an imperial palace.

sen.j: 御所跡地が国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The site of the former imperial palace has been designated a historic site.
The site of the former imperial palace has been designated a historic site.
The site of the former imperial palace has been designated a historic site.

sen.j: 伽藍
sen.e: Monastery
Monastery
Monastery

sen.j: 皇室ゆかりの寺院である大覚寺には、宮廷風の建築や皇室ゆかりの建物を移築したものが多い。
sen.e: Due to Daikaku-ji Temple's close ties to the imperial household, it has many buildings that have been constructed in the style of or relocated from the imperial court.
Due to Daikaku-ji Temple's close ties to the imperial household, it has many buildings that have been constructed in the style of or relocated from the Imperial Court.
Due to Daikaku-ji Temple's close ties to the imperial household, it has many buildings that have been constructed in the style of or relocated from the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 伽藍の中軸線上には南から勅使門（唐門）、御影堂、心経殿が建ち、御影堂の東に五大堂、西に宸殿、宸殿の北側に正寝殿が建つ。
sen.e: At the south of the central monastery are the chokushi-mon gate (gate for imperial envoys which is a Chinese style gate); Mie-do; and Shingyo-den, to the east of Mie-do is Godai-do, to the west is Shinden, and to the north of Shinden is Shoshin-den.

On the center line of the central monastery, from the south, are the chokushi-mon gate (gate for imperial envoys which is a Chinese style gate); Mie-do; and Shingyo-den, to the east of Mie-do is Godai-do, to the west is Shinden, and to the north of Shinden is Shoshin-den.
sen.cmt: 伽藍の中軸線上には、部分を訂正。Godai-doの前のスペースを調整。
sen.e: On the center line of the central monastery, from the south, are the chokushi-mon gate (gate for imperial envoys which is a Chinese style gate); Mie-do; and Shingyo-den, to the east of Mie-do is Godai-do, to the west is Shinden, and to the north of Shinden is Shoshin-den.

sen.j: これらの建物の間は屋根付きの廊下で結ばれている。
sen.e: These buildings are connected by roofed corridors.
These buildings are connected by roofed corridors.
These buildings are connected by roofed corridors.

sen.j: 伽藍の中心部に位置しているのは、本堂にあたる五大堂ではなく、嵯峨天皇ほかの歴代天皇が書写した般若心経を収める心経殿である点が注目される。
sen.e: Located at the central position of the monastery is not the main building Godai-do but rather the Shingyo-den which houses the copies of the heart sutra that have been transcribed by successive emperors including Emperor Saga.

Located at the central position of the monastery is not the main building Godai-do but rather the Shingyo-den which houses the copies of the heart sutra that have been transcribed by successive emperors including Emperor Saga.

Located at the central position of the monastery is not the main building Godai-do but rather the Shingyo-den which houses the copies of the heart sutra that have been transcribed by successive emperors including Emperor Saga.

sen.j: 宸殿（重要文化財）‐東福門院（後水尾天皇中宮）の旧殿を移築したものと伝える。
sen.e: Shinden (Important Cultural Property) - Said to be the relocated Tofukumon'in (Emperor Go-Mizunoo's palace).
sen.cmt: ・Important Cultural Property: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Shinden (Important Cultural Property) - Said to be the relocated Tofukumon'in (Emperor Go-Mizunoo) 's palace.
sen.cmt: s palaceを括弧の外に出した。
sen.e: Shinden (Important Cultural Property) - Said to be the relocated Tofukumon'in (Emperor Go-Mizunoo) 's palace.

sen.j: 蔀戸（しとみど）を用いた寝殿造風の建物で、屋根は入母屋造、檜皮葺きとし、周囲に広縁をめぐらす。
sen.e: This building is in a Shinden-zukuri style with wooden lattice shutters, a hip-and-gable cypress bark roof and a broad veranda.
sen.cmt: ・Shinden-zukuri: http://www.culturalprofiles.net/japan/Directories/Japan_Cultural_Profile/-13491.html、プログレッシブ和英中辞典・hip-and-gable roof: http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/i/irimoyazukuri.htm・cypress bark roof: http://www.j-prep.com/reference/word?sub=tru&ss=%E7%9A%AE&type=vocab&dex=60&type=vocab&bid=1782210
sen.e: This building is in a Shinden-zukuri style with wooden lattice shutters, a hip-and-gable cypress bark roof and a broad veranda.
This building is in a Shinden-zukuri style with wooden lattice shutters, a hip-and-gable cypress bark roof and a broad veranda.

sen.j: 「宸殿」は門跡寺院に特有の建物名で、「宸」は「皇帝」の意である。
sen.e: The word 'shinden' is only used at temples in which a member of the imperial household resided and the 'shin' part of the word signifies the emperor.
The word 'shinden' is only used at temples in which a member of the imperial household resided and the 'shin' part of the word signifies the emperor.
The word 'shinden' is only used at temples in which a member of the imperial household resided and the 'shin' part of the word signifies the emperor.

sen.j: 内部は大きく4室に分かれ、中でも南側の「牡丹の間」の牡丹図と北側の「紅梅の間」の紅梅図の襖絵（ともに狩野山楽筆）は名高い（襖絵のオリジナルは収蔵庫に収められ、現在ここにある襖絵は複製である）。
sen.e: The interior is largely divided into 4 rooms and is particularly well-known for the sliding screens of its south 'Peony Room' which are adorned with paintings of peony flowers and those of the north 'Japanese Apricot Room' which are decorated with paintings of Japanese apricot trees with red blossoms (both by Sanraku KANO) (the original sliding screen paintings have been put into storage and the ones currently on display are reproductions).

The interior is largely divided into 4 rooms and is particularly well-known for the sliding screens of its south 'Peony Room' which are adorned with paintings of peony flowers and those of the north 'Japanese Apricot Room' which are decorated with paintings of Japanese apricot trees with red blossoms (both by Sanraku KANO) (the original sliding screen paintings have been put into storage and the ones currently on display are reproductions).

The interior is largely divided into 4 rooms and is particularly well-known for the sliding screens of its south 'Peony Room' which are adorned with paintings of peony flowers and those of the north 'Japanese Apricot Room' which are decorated with paintings of Japanese apricot trees with red blossoms (both by Sanraku KANO) (the original sliding screen paintings have been put into storage and the ones currently on display are reproductions).

sen.j: 前庭には一面に白砂が敷き詰められ、右近の橘と左近の梅（左近の「桜」ではない）がある。
sen.e: The front garden is covered in white sand with tachibana trees on the right and Japanese apricot trees on the left (those on the left are not sakura cherry trees).
The front garden is covered in white sand with tachibana trees on the right and Japanese apricot trees on the left (those on the left are not sakura cherry trees).
The front garden is covered in white sand with tachibana trees on the right and Japanese apricot trees on the left (those on the left are not sakura cherry trees).

sen.j: 御影堂‐入母屋造、桟瓦葺き。
sen.e: Mie-do - Features a hip-and-gable roof with base tiles.
Mie-do - Features a hip-and-gable roof with base tiles.
Mie-do - Features a hip-and-gable roof with base tiles.

sen.j: 伽藍の中心部に位置し、北側に建つ心経殿の拝殿のような役割をしている。
sen.e: It is located in the center of the monastery and serves a role like that of a haiden (worship hall) for the Shingyo-den to its north.
It is located in the center of the monastery and serves a role like that of a haiden (worship hall) for the Shingyo-den to its north.
It is located in the center of the monastery and serves a role like that of a haiden (worship hall) for the Shingyo-den to its north.

sen.j: この建物は大正天皇の即位式に使用された饗応殿を下賜され、大正14年（1925年）、後宇多法皇600回忌を機に大覚寺へ移築されたものである。
sen.e: This is the banquet hall that was used at the coronation of Emperor Taisho, which was bestowed to the temple and relocated to its current site on the 600th anniversary of the death of the monk-emperor Go-Uda in 1925.

This is the banquet hall that was used at the coronation of Emperor Taisho, which was bestowed to the temple and relocated to its current site on the 600th anniversary of the death of the monk-emperor Go-Uda in 1925.

This is the banquet hall that was used at the coronation of Emperor Taisho, which was bestowed to the temple and relocated to its current site on the 600th anniversary of the death of the Cloistered Emperor Go-Uda in 1925.

sen.j: 堂内の中心部は北側に建つ心経殿の拝所となり、その左右に大覚寺にゆかりの深い嵯峨天皇、弘法大師（空海）、後宇多法皇、恒寂法親王の像を安置する。
sen.e: The center of the interior serves as a place of worship for the Shingyo-den that stands to its north and it enshrines the statues of individuals closely related to the history of Daikaku-ji Temple such as Emperor Saga, Kobo-Daishi (Kukai), the monk-emperor Go-Uda and Kojaku-Hosshinno.

The center of the interior serves as a place of worship for the Shingyo-den that stands to its north and it enshrines the statues of individuals closely related to the history of Daikaku-ji Temple such as Emperor Saga, Kobo-Daishi (Kukai), the monk-emperor Go-Uda and Kojaku-Hosshinno.

The center of the interior serves as a place of worship for the Shingyo-den that stands to its north and it enshrines the statues of individuals closely related to the history of Daikaku-ji Temple such as Emperor Saga, Kobo-Daishi (Kukai), the Cloistered Emperor Go-Uda and Kojaku-Hosshinno.

sen.j: 五大堂‐大覚寺の本堂。
sen.e: Godai-do - Daikaku-ji Temple's main hall.
Godai-do - Daikaku-ji Temple's main hall.
Godai-do - Daikaku-ji Temple's main hall.

sen.j: 境内東側に位置する。
sen.e: It is located on the eastern side of the temple grounds.
It is located on the eastern side of the temple grounds.
It is located on the eastern side of the temple grounds.

sen.j: 天明年間（1781－1789年）の建立。
sen.e: The structure was built between 1781 and 1789.
The structure was built between 1781 and 1789.
The structure was built between 1781 and 1789.

sen.j: 当初は伽藍の中心部（御影堂前の現在、石舞台がある位置）にあったが、大正14年（1925年）、御影堂が移築された際に現在の位置に移動した。
sen.e: It was initially situated at the center of the monastery (in front of Mie-do where the stone stage now sits), but was moved to its current location when the Mie-do was relocated to the monastery in 1925.

It was initially situated at the center of the monastery (in front of Mie-do where the stone stage now sits), but was moved to its current location when the Mie-do was relocated to the monastery in 1925.

It was initially situated at the center of the monastery (in front of Mie-do where the stone stage now sits), but was moved to its current location when the Mie-do was relocated to the monastery in 1925.

sen.j: 元来この堂の本尊であった鎌倉時代作の五大明王像は収蔵庫に移され、現在は松久朋琳・松久宗琳が昭和50年（1975年）に完成した五大明王像を本尊として安置している。
sen.e: The original principal objects of veneration were the Kamakura period statues of the Five Wisdom Kings but these have since been put into storage and the statues of the Five Wisdom Kings currently housed within were completed by Horin MATSUHISA and Sorin MATSUHISA in 1975.

The original principal objects of veneration were the Kamakura period statues of the Five Great Wisdom Kings but these have since been put into storage and the statues of the Five Great Wisdom Kings currently housed within were completed by Horin MATSUHISA and Sorin MATSUHISA in 1975.
sen.cmt: 五大明王の、Greatを二箇所に補足。
sen.e: The original principal objects of veneration were the Kamakura period statues of the Five Great Wisdom Kings but these have since been put into storage and the statues of the Five Great Wisdom Kings currently housed within were completed by Horin MATSUHISA and Sorin MATSUHISA in 1975.

sen.j: 堂は写経道場として用いられており、堂の東側の縁からは大沢池を望むことができる。
sen.e: The hall is used for the transcription of sutras and Osawa-no-ike Pond can be seen from its eastern edge.
The hall is used for the transcription of sutras and Osawa-no-ike Pond can be seen from its eastern edge.
The hall is used for the transcription of sutras and Osawa-no-ike Pond can be seen from its eastern edge.

sen.j: 心経殿‐御影堂の北に建つ。
sen.e: Shingyo-den - Situated north of the Mie-do.
Shingyo-den - Situated north of the Mie-do.
Shingyo-den - Situated north of the Mie-do.

sen.j: 大正14年（1925年）建立の鉄筋コンクリート造の小規模な八角堂で、壁面は校倉造風である。
sen.e: This small octagonal hall was constructed from reinforced concrete in 1925 and has Azekura-zukuri style walls.
sen.cmt: ・Azekura-zukuri: プログレッシブ和英中辞典
sen.e: This small octagonal hall was constructed from reinforced concrete in 1925 and has Azekura-zukuri style walls.
This small octagonal hall was constructed from reinforced concrete in 1925 and has Azekura-zukuri style walls.

sen.j: 内部には嵯峨天皇、後光厳天皇、後花園天皇、後奈良天皇、正親町天皇、光格天皇の直筆の般若心経を収蔵し、薬師如来像を安置する。
sen.e: Housed within are heart sutras hand written by Emperor Saga, Emperor Go-Kogon, Emperor Go-Hanazono, Emperor Go-Nara, Emperor Ogimachi and Emperor Kokaku in addition to a statue of Yakushi Nyorai.
Housed within are heart sutras hand written by Emperor Saga, Emperor Go-Kogon, Emperor Go-Hanazono, Emperor Go-Nara, Emperor Ogimachi and Emperor Kokaku in addition to a statue of Yakushi Nyorai.
Housed within are heart sutras hand written by Emperor Saga, Emperor Go-Kogon, Emperor Go-Hanazono, Emperor Go-Nara, Emperor Ogimachi and Emperor Kokaku in addition to a statue of Yakushi Nyorai.

sen.j: 内部は非公開で、開扉は60年に一度とされている。
sen.e: The interior is not open to the public and the doors are only opened once every 60 years.
The interior is not open to the public and the doors are only opened once every 60 years.
The interior is not open to the public and the doors are only opened once every 60 years.

sen.j: 建物は国の登録有形文化財に登録されている。
sen.e: The building is one of the nation's registered tangible cultural properties.
sen.cmt: ・registered tangible cultural properties: http://waei.hounavi.jp/ej_search_tangible.php、英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The building is one of the nation's registered tangible cultural properties.

sen.j: 正寝殿‐重要文化財指定名称は「客殿」。
sen.e: Shoshin-den - Designated an Important Cultural Property under the name 'kyakuden' (guest hall).
sen.cmt: ・Important Cultural Property: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Shoshin-den - Designated an Important Cultural Property under the name 'kyakuden' (guest hall).
Shoshin-den - Designated an Important Cultural Property under the name 'kyakuden' (guest hall).

sen.j: 桃山時代建立の書院造建築で、内部は大小12の部屋に分かれる。
sen.e: The Shoin-zukuri style building was constructed during the Momoyama Period and is divided into 12 rooms.
sen.cmt: ・Shoin-zukuri: http://www.kcif.or.jp/en/newsletter/lik/archives/01_2001.htm、プログレッシブ和英中辞典
sen.e: The Shoin-zukuri style building was constructed during the Momoyama Period and is divided into 12 rooms.
The Shoin-zukuri style building was constructed during the Momoyama Period and is divided into 12 rooms.

sen.j: 「上段の間」（御冠の間）には玉座があり、後宇多院が院政を行った部屋を再現したものである。
sen.e: The room named 'Jodan-no-ma' (Okammuri-no-ma (chamber of the crown)) has a throne and is a recreation of the room from which Emperor Go-Uda governed.
The room named 'Jodan-no-ma' (Okammuri-no-ma (chamber of the crown)) has a throne and is a recreation of the room from which Emperor Go-Uda governed.
The room named 'Jodan-no-ma' (Okanmuri-no-ma (chamber of the crown)) has a throne and is a recreation of the room from which Emperor Go-Uda governed.

sen.j: 障壁画は狩野山楽および渡辺始興の筆。
sen.e: The partition paintings were done by Sanraku KANO and Shiko WATANABE.
The partition paintings were done by Sanraku KANO and Shiko WATANABE.
The partition paintings were done by Sanraku KANO and Shiko WATANABE.

sen.j: 霊明殿‐総理大臣を務めた斎藤実が昭和3年（1928年）、東京の沼袋（現・中野区沼袋）に建てた日仏寺の本堂だったもの。
sen.e: Reimei-den - Was originally the main building of Nichibutsu-ji Temple constructed in Tokyo's Numabukuro (now Numabukuro, Nakano Ward) by Prime Minister Makoto SAITO in 1928.
Reimei-den - Was originally the main building of Nichibutsu-ji Temple constructed in Tokyo's Numabukuro (now Numabukuro, Nakano Ward) by Prime Minister Makoto SAITO in 1928.
Reimei-den - Was originally the main building of Nichibutsu-ji Temple constructed in Tokyo's Numabukuro (now Numabukuro, Nakano Ward) by Prime Minister Makoto SAITO in 1928.

sen.j: 昭和33年（1958年）、当時大覚寺門跡であった草繋全宜（くさなぎぜんぎ）が移築した。
sen.e: It was relocated to its current site in 1958 by Daikaku-ji Temple's head priest Kusanagi Zengi.
It was relocated to its current site in 1958 by Daikaku-ji Temple's head priest Kusanagi Zengi.
It was relocated to its current site in 1958 by Daikaku-ji Temple's head priest Kusanagi Zengi.

sen.j: 縁板まで含め総朱塗りとした建物で、阿弥陀如来を本尊とする。
sen.e: The entire building is coated in vermillion lacquer right down to the veranda boards and it enshrines a statue of Amida Nyorai.
sen.cmt: ・Amida Nyorai: 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: The entire building is coated in vermillion lacquer right down to the veranda boards and it enshrines a statue of Amida Nyorai.

sen.j: 貴賓館‐秩父宮の御殿として大正12年（1923年）、東宮仮御所の霞ヶ関離宮（現・国会前庭）に建立されたもの。
sen.e: Kihinkan - This building was originally constructed in 1923 in Kasumigaseki Rikyu at Togu Palace temporary residence as the court of Chichibu-no-Miya.
Kihinkan - This building was originally constructed in 1923 in Kasumigaseki Rikyu at Togu Palace temporary residence as the court of Chichibu-no-Miya.
Kihinkan - This building was originally constructed in 1923 in Kasumigaseki Rikyu at Togu Palace (present day Diet Building front garden) temporary residence as the court of Chichibu-no-Miya.

sen.j: 昭和46年（1971年）、大覚寺に移築された。
sen.e: It was relocated to Daitoku-ji Temple in 1971.
It was relocated to Daitoku-ji Temple in 1971.
It was relocated to Daikaku-ji Temple in 1971.

sen.j: 非公開。
sen.e: It is not open to the public.
It is not open to the public.
It is not open to the public.

sen.j: 庭湖館‐江戸時代中期、大沢池畔に建てられた休憩所を明治元年（1868年）に移築したもの。
sen.e: Teikokan - Built as a rest area on the bank of Osawa-no-ike Pond during the mid Edo period and relocated in 1968.
Teikokan - Built as a rest area on the bank of Osawa-no-ike Pond during the mid Edo period and relocated in 1868.

sen.j: 非公開。
sen.e: It is not open to the public.
It is not open to the public.
It is not open to the public.

sen.j: このほか、伽藍東側の大沢池周辺には護摩堂、大日堂、聖天堂、五社明神などの小堂や、昭和42年（1967年）建立の心経宝塔（多宝塔）などが建つ。
sen.e: In addition, small halls including Goma-do, Dainichi-do, Shoten-do and Gosha Myojin surround Osawa-no-ike Pond on the eastern side of the monastery, with others such as Shingyo-hoto (Tahoto) having been built in 1967.

In addition, small halls including Goma-do, Dainichi-do, Shoten-do and Gosha Myojin surround Osawa-no-ike Pond on the eastern side of the monastery, with others such as Shingyo-hoto (Tahoto) having been built in 1967.

In addition, small halls including Goma-do, Dainichi-do, Shoten-do and Gosha Myojin surround Osawa-no-ike Pond on the eastern side of the monastery, with others such as Shingyo-hoto (Tahoto) having been built in 1967.

sen.j: 大沢池と名古曽の滝
sen.e: Osawa-no-ike Pond & Nakoso-no-taki Rapids
Osawa-no-ike Pond & Nakoso-no-taki Rapids
Osawa-no-ike Pond & Nakoso-no-taki Rapids

sen.j: 大沢池は中国の洞庭湖を模して嵯峨天皇が築造したものといわれ、当時の唐風文化の面影を今に残す園地は池の北方約100メートルにある「名古曽の滝」とともに1923（大正12年）に国の文化財として名勝指定されている。
sen.e: Osawa-no-ike Pond, said to have been constructed by Emperor Saga, is based on China's Lake Dongting, and this pond that still reflects the Chinese Tang Dynasty style culture of the time was designated a scenic spot in 1923 along with the 'Nakoso-no-taki Rapids' approximately 100m north of the pond.
sen.cmt: ・Lake Dongting: http://www.daikakuji.or.jp/english/scene/tre/l.html、プログレッシブ和英中辞典・Nakoso-no-taki Rapids: http://www.daikakuji.or.jp/english/scene/index.html#about2・原文の「園地」を「園池」に訂正
sen.e: Osawa-no-ike Pond, said to have been constructed by Emperor Saga, is based on China's Lake Dongting, and this pond that still reflects the Chinese Tang Dynasty style culture of the time was designated a scenic spot as a National Cultural Property in 1923 along with the 'Nakoso-no-taki Rapids' approximately 100m north of the pond.
sen.cmt: 国の文化財として→as a National Cultural Property を補足。
sen.e: Osawa-no-ike Pond, said to have been constructed by Emperor Saga, is based on China's Lake Dongting, and this pond that still reflects the Chinese Tang Dynasty style culture of the time was designated a scenic spot as a National Cultural Property in 1923 along with the 'Nakoso-no-taki Rapids' approximately 100 m north of the pond.
sen.cmt: 単位mの前にスペース挿入

sen.j: 嵯峨院の園池を引き継ぐものと推定されているが、これは南東にゆるく傾斜する地形を利用して南から東にかけて長い堤を築することで北西側からの流れをせき止めて築造された人工の池として知られる。
sen.e: It is known as being an artificial lake created by using terrain that gently slopes to the southeast and building a long bank running from south to east which serves to dam the flow from the northwest.

It is known as being an artificial lake created by using terrain that gently slopes to the southeast and building a long bank running from south to east which serves to dam the flow from the northwest.

It is known as being an artificial lake created by using terrain that gently slopes to the southeast and building a long bank running from south to east which serves to dam the flow from the northwest.

sen.j: この池はまた周辺水田の灌漑用水として重要な役割を果たしてきたことが知られている。
sen.e: The pond is also known to serve a valuable role in providing irrigation water to surrounding paddy fields.
一原文一訳文の例外対処
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 平安時代前期の名残をとどめ、日本最古の庭池とされている。
sen.e: With its traces of the early Heian period, it is thought to be the oldest garden pond in Japan.
With its traces of the early Heian period, it is thought to be the oldest garden pond in Japan.
With its traces of the early Heian period, it is thought to be the oldest garden pond in Japan.

sen.j: 昭和56年から始まった発掘調査によって、この2石は当初の位置にあるものの、その他の石は後代の手が加わっていると推定されている。
sen.e: According to the excavation survey that began in 1981, it is now presumed that, although these two stones are in their original locations, all of the other stones were later placed intentionally.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the excavation survey that began in 1981, it is now presumed that, although these two stones are in their original locations, all of the other stones were later placed intentionally.
According to the excavation survey that began in 1981, it is now presumed that, although these two stones are in their original locations, all of the other stones were later placed intentionally.

sen.j: また滝の南方には素堀に近い蛇行溝が開削されて大沢池へ注いでいたことが調査でわかっていて、これは自然の流れを模して造られた庭園の遣水施設である。
sen.e: It is also understood from the survey that an almost unlined meandering channel had been excavated south of the waterfall that feeds into Osawa-no-ike Pond and that this is a shallow, curving garden stream had been created by imitating a natural flow.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also understood from the survey that an almost unlined meandering channel had been excavated south of the waterfall that feeds into Osawa-no-ike Pond and that this is a shallow, curving garden stream had been created by imitating a natural flow.

It is also understood from the survey that an almost unlined meandering channel had been excavated south of the waterfall that feeds into Osawa-no-ike Pond and that this is a shallow, curving garden stream had been created by imitating a natural flow.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇が譲位を契機として冷然院からこの新院へと遷御した時期に最大幅約12メートル、深さ約1メートル規模拡張された。
sen.e: When Emperor Saga abdicated and used the opportunity to move from his mansion named 'Reizeiin' to his new mansion, he expanded the channel to approximately 12m at its widest and 1m at its deepest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Emperor Saga abdicated and used the opportunity to move from his mansion named 'Reizeiin' to his new mansion, he expanded the channel to approximately 12m at its widest and 1m at its deepest.
When Emperor Saga abdicated and used the opportunity to move from his mansion named 'Reizeiin' to his new mansion, he expanded the channel to approximately 12 m at its widest and 1 m at its deepest.
sen.cmt: 単位mの前にスペース挿入

sen.j: 拡張と同時に流末に水位調節のために石組み溝が新たに設けられ、これによって流路全体がせき止められて池状のたまりとなっていた。
sen.e: While carrying out this expansion work, he assembled rocks and reconfigured the channel to control the water level at the end of the flow, which resulted in the water course becoming completely dammed and causing it to pool as a pond.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While carrying out this expansion work, he assembled rocks and reconfigured the channel to control the water level at the end of the flow, which resulted in the water course becoming completely dammed and causing it to pool as a pond.

While carrying out this expansion work, he assembled rocks and reconfigured the channel to control the water level at the end of the flow, which resulted in the water course becoming completely dammed and causing it to pool as a pond.

sen.j: このことから改修時期には供給される水量が減少し、池の注ぎ口に設けられた溝もやがて埋没した。
sen.e: From this stage, he began a period of modification in which he decreased the quantity of water supplied and eventually filled in the channel leading out of the pond.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From this stage, he began a period of modification in which he decreased the quantity of water supplied and eventually filled in the channel leading out of the pond.
From this stage, he began a period of modification in which he decreased the quantity of water supplied and eventually filled in the channel leading out of the pond.

sen.j: 流水方向に直交して低い土手が築かれてここに帯状に玉石敷が造られると同時に施設の西側に景石が添えられた。
sen.e: He then constructed a low bank perpendicular to the direction of the flow in which he laid a belt-shaped stone bed while adding an ornamental stone in the west of the site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He then constructed a low bank perpendicular to the direction of the flow in which he laid a belt-shaped stone bed while adding an ornamental stone in the west of the site.
He then constructed a low bank perpendicular to the direction of the flow in which he laid a belt-shaped stone bed while adding an ornamental stone in the west of the site.

sen.j: この施設によって流路は大きくせき止められて広大なたまりを形成しオーバーフローして大沢池に注ぎ込むこととなっていたものと考えられている。
sen.e: This drastically dammed the water course and caused extensive filling which overflowed and fed into Osawa-no-ike Pond.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This drastically dammed the water course and caused extensive filling which overflowed and fed into Osawa-no-ike Pond.
This drastically dammed the water course and caused extensive filling which overflowed and fed into Osawa-no-ike Pond.

sen.j: 後宇多天皇宸翰御手印遺告（ごうだてんのう しんかん ごていん ゆいごう）-「宸翰」は天皇自筆の意。
sen.e: Writing of Emperor Go-Uda - Gotein Yuigo written by the emperor himself.

sen.j: 後宇多天皇（法皇）が、大覚寺の興隆を願って書きおいた遺言の自筆草稿で、紙面に天皇の手形が押されている。
sen.e: This manuscript was written Emperor Go-Uda (who abdicated and became a monk) to serve as a last will and testament describing his wishes for the prosperity of Daikaku-ji Temple and also includes his actual hand-prints on the pages.

sen.j: 後宇多天皇宸翰弘法大師伝-真言密教に帰依した後宇多天皇が、自ら正和4年（1315年）に書いた弘法大師伝の自筆本。
